metadata.title: CVE-2024-35242 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Composer is a dependency manager for PHP. On the 2.x branch prior toversions 2.2.24 and 2.7.7, the `composer install` command running inside agit/hg repository which has specially crafted branch names can lead tocommand injection. This requires cloning untrusted repositories. Patchesare available in version 2.2.24 for 2.2 LTS or 2.7.7 for mainline. As aworkaround, avoid cloning potentially compromised repositories.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

composer - 2.7.7-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: composer package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.7-2').
